transcript.title: Prime Minister to attend Australia New Zealand Leaders' Meeting in Queenstown
transcript.content:
I will travel to New Zealand to attend the annual Australia New Zealand Leadersâ€™ Meeting on 17 February in Queenstown.

I look forward to meeting Prime Minister Bill English for the first time since he took office in December last year.

The Treasurer and the Industry, Innovation and Science Minister will accompany me, reflecting our desire to strengthen the economic relationship.

The visit will be an opportunity to further advance Trans-Tasman links and deepen our collaboration with one of our closest partners.

New Zealand is a neighbour, ally and friend. Our nations have a very successful and collaborative relationship built on shared history and values that we will continue to strengthen to the benefit of both our countries.
